TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebConfigurationFileMap extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationFileMap

Docs.summary: Defines the configuration file mappings for a Web application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationFileMap> class is used to specify the Web configuration file hierarchy. By default, the configuration system uses the IIS metabase to determine the Web file hierarchy. If IIS is not installed, or if an application targets a version of the .NET Framework that is not the latest version that is installed on the server, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationFileMap> class provides a means to define a custom hierarchy.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationFileMap> class can specify a single path or multiple paths related to configuration files.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string machineConfigFileName) cil managed

Docs.param: The machine configuration file name with the complete physical path (for example, c:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v2.0.50727\CONFIG\machine.config).
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified machine configuration file name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use this constructor when you are targeting a version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] that is earlier than the latest one that is installed on the computer. The method enables you to specify a machine configuration file that is appropriate to the version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] that you are targeting.
> [!NOTE] > Even though the constructor only accepts the path to the Machine.config file, the configuration system will also read the root Web.config file in the same directory where the Machine.config file exists.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of a class with the same value as the existing instance.
Docs.returns: A new instance of a class.

Docs.summary: Gets the listed collection of virtual directories for a Web application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The virtual directories of a Web application may not necessarily map to the physical directories on the server. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.VirtualDirectoryMapping> class is independent of IIS.
